sub_title: EF LD20 | Visiting Researcher @MIT | Individual Double Masters @TU Delft MSc Embedded Systems and MSc Computer Science | Founder @Respire | Sigma Squared Fellow | Sustainable Young (DJ) 100 2021 | Entrepreneurship
summary:
"What's the use of your education if you haven't created an impact in the world"
  
I try to approach things from an entrepreneurial mindset, having gained relevant technological skills from my past experiences. I have won several hackathons and various technical competitions in the past year owing to a combination of my technological background, creativity, pitching skills, and business acumen.

My education in both electrical engineering and computer science has allowed me to be familiar with most aspects of both hardware and software. I am proficient in various fields needed in the development of a technological product from the ground up from low-level analog electronics, digital electronics, communication protocols, backend for data aggregation to high-level front-end interface for the end user & actuation with deep learning and network science at the top level.

Got accepted for a D.Phil at the University of Oxford in the UK but ended up pursuing my Ph.D. at TU Delft (funded directly by faculty) allowing high flexibility in my research areas on the intersection of climate science, machine learning, and IoT. I graduated cum-laude in both MSc Embedded Systems and MSc Computer Science from TU Delft in 2022 owing to a period as visiting student at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Senseable City lab which led to two papers (submitted to the journals Nature Sustainability and IEEE IoT). I further obtained entrepreneurship annotation during my master's studies. My specialization in the domain of optimization and networking aspects of embedded systems, and the artificial intelligence domain for computer science enables me to modularise and ideate based on raw hardware and software, from ground-up. I am mainly interested in IoT, hardware-based sensing, and applied problems in machine learning.

education.degree_name: University of Delhi, Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.)

With Jose Ignacio de Alvear Cardenas, R. Venkatesha Prasad

awards.description: Invited to represent the student community at the panel discussion for digitalization in Ghana event along with professors from TU Delft and ministers from Ghana regarding future opportunities and challenges.

awards.title: Invited Speaker: SCAI Workshop at SIGIR 2022
awards.description:
Invited for giving a talk regarding the Evaluation of conversational interfaces.
More info: https://scai.info/

awards.title: 2nd Prize: MIT Water Hackathon
awards.description: Our team was awarded $3000 for prototyping a computer vision based solution for optimal flood response.

awards.title: EFL Stichting Travel Grant
awards.description: https://efl-stichting.nl/subsidie/akshit-gupta-tu-delft/

awards.title: FAST Fund
awards.description: EUR 500, awarded for master’s research at Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Boston/Cambridge.

awards.title: Gift/Grant for Master’s Research
awards.description: EUR: 2150, awarded for master’s thesis work at Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Boston/Cambridge.
awards.issuer: Fundatie van de Vrijvrouwe van Renswoude de Delft

awards.title: €1000 Prize: Hack the music Industry
awards.description: My team Webduet was awarded €1000 in the hack the music industry Hackathon organised by Ultrahack. WebDuet is an online platform that allows real-time collaboration with other musicians, even if they are across borders, using a low-latency peer to peer connection to connect MIDI instruments. Developed majorly by Shaad Alka, refined and pitched by Akshit Gupta and Pablo Biedma.

awards.title: Winner: Hack Zurich 2021 (Xylem Challenge)
awards.description:
We built a deep learning based decision support system to provide danger ratings for the images obtained from CCTVs to optimise rescue team deployment during floods.
Our team was awarded $2500 along with goodies and declared winner for the challenge proposed by Xylem out of more than 1200 participants at HackZurich 2021. The project was later covered by media outlets including Bloomberg and Yahoo finance amongst others. 
More details available here: 
https://devpost.com/software/res-queue
https://finance.yahoo.com/news/hackers-help-communities-combat-effects-103900817.html

awards.title: Fellow at Sigma Squared Society (formerly Kairos Society)
awards.description: The Sigma Squared Fellowship brings together the world’s best entrepreneurs under 26 each year. I was one of the 103 new Fellows accepted in 2021 from all over the world.

awards.title: Sustainable Young DJ100: jury-selected list of top 100 sustainability young frontrunners in the Netherlands
awards.description:
The "DJ100" is a jury-selected list of the top-100 young entrepreneurs, young professionals and students with the most innovative and inspiring initiatives, ideas, and start-ups in the field of sustainability. I made it to the list for the year 2021.
See: https://dj100.nl/akshit-gupta/

awards.title: Sponsorship: Dragon’s Den by Stud Delft
awards.description: Respire was awarded €750 sponsorship and personnel hiring support at the Dragon’s Den event organised by Stud Delft.

awards.title: 1st Prize : ReadyToStartup
awards.description: Respire was chosen as grand prize winner of ReadyToStartup! organised by YES! Delft and Rolland Berger winning EUR 1500.

awards.title: Winner: Hack Zurich (Roche Diagnostics Challenge)
awards.description:
We built a conversational interface to be used diabetes patients along with a mobile based glucose detection module developed by Roche.
More details available here: https://devpost.com/software/doctor-sugar
Our team was awarded 900 CHF and declared winner for the challenge proposed by Roche out of more than 1095 participants at HackZurich 2020.

awards.title: Winner: Wildcard Dutch 4TU Impact Challenge & Finalist: Ideation
awards.description: Project Respire was chosen to represent TU Delft at the Dutch 4TU Impact challenge (national) based upon societal impact out of 80 other projects. Further, top 9 in Ideation category.

awards.title: Philips Innovation Award - Encouragement Prize and Semi Finalist
awards.description: Encouragement Award for being amongst the 10 best ideas of the idea stage of the Philips Innovation Award 2020 (EUR 100). Also reached the Semi Final for the same.

awards.title: 2nd Prize EIT Deephack: Hacking Mobility with IoT
awards.description: My prototype on optimising electric vehicle charging infrastructure was awarded as the most implementable idea and first runner up in terms of cash prize, winning EUR 1500.

awards.title: 2nd Prize Tech Quest: YES! Delft And Aramco
awards.description: My team came 2nd in this one day challenge to solve a real world problem faced by Aramco, won direct entry to co-lab in YES! Delft.

projects.title: Respire
projects.description: Details available only on request. Won 2nd Prize in TU Delft Global Prototype Competition and Philips Innovation Award 2020 Encouragement Prize, Winner: Wildcard Dutch 4TU impact challenge, Finalist: TU Delft Impact Contest 2020

projects.title: Auto Text Extractor for POI/POA
projects.description: Android app which uses ML-Kit for on-device machine learning for text extraction from Proof of Address (Adhaar Card) and Proof of identity (PAN card). A pre-trained ML model is used from firebase for inference.

projects.title: Extensible Home automation system in a budget(HAB)
projects.description: Made a home automation system using Raspberry pi as hub and arduino as nodes.(Action node and Sensor node both).Here OpenHAB was used as central software controlling all the nodes which could be accessed from an app as well as web interface.Also,nodes could be added by the user on a plug and play basis.

projects.title: Res-Queue
projects.description:
An AI based decision support system called Res-Queue was developed in 40 hours in HackZurich 2021. This helps rescue management control room to optimize rescue teams deployment during disasters by utilising a multitude of digital data.
This won the the Xylem Challenge at HackZurich 2021.

projects.title: Doctor Sugar
projects.description: A conversational agent was built over 2 days at HackZurich 2020 in the form of a web app and the same was integrated with telegram. This is supposed to be used in developing countries in order to increase engagement of diabetes patients with a smartphone based glucose detection module developed by Roche. This won the the Roche Diagnostics Challenge at HackZurich 2020.

Visiting Graduate Student at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard

projects.title: SeamEye
projects.description: We have built a novel wearable device, SeamEye, to measure the bowling speed of cricket bowlers during training using low cost accelerometer, gyroscope and machine learning on the edge.  A project which shows how physics, embedded sensors and machine learning on edge can coalesce to solve a problem which was considered impossible 2 years ago.

contributors.headline: EF LD20 | Visiting Researcher @MIT | Individual Double Masters @TU Delft MSc Embedded Systems and MSc Computer Science | Founder @Respire | Sigma Squared Fellow | Sustainable Young (DJ) 100 2021 | Entrepreneurship
MSc Student in Computer Science at University of Trento, Italy

projects.title: Rider in the Storm
projects.description: This is probably my most under recognised project, yet one of the most fun to make. A weekend project which shows machine to machine(M2M) interaction over internet using voice. Potential application: 2 way Interaction with any low cost touch free large display for the user using voice.

projects.title: Smart Home With Real Time Face Identification and Voice Control (B. Tech Grad Project)
projects.description:
Created an interactive and scalable Smart Home system with custom built hardware, firmware and open source Software and services. Machine Learning services used in backend server made the system cognitive.
Raspberry Pi used as central server and hub running Home Assistant.
Azure Face API used for face identification and Alexa Voice Services used for voice control.
Google TTS used for speech based interaction.

projects.title: Intervalometer made using 8085
projects.description:
An intervalometer is a device which is used primarily to create time lapse videos. Built using 8085 microprocessor which controlled a canon D5300 DSLR and clicked photos at regular intervals as specified by the user depending on frames per second (fps) specified. Later all these pictures are stitched using a premade software to make a time-lapse video.
Everything coded in native assembly language with the appropriate memory allocation in RAM and EEPROM.

courses.name: Data Analysis and Modelling of Complex Networks
Wireless IoT and Local Area Networks

profile_positions.description:
Funded directly by faculty allowing high flexibility in my research areas at the intersection of climate science, machine learning and IoT. Supervised by Remko Uijlenhoet and Martine Rutten.
Currently, looking at monitoring of environmental parameters at high spatio-temporal resolutions using custom-developed hardware and software. Took break in April 2023 after passing the go/no meeting in 9 months  and returned in August 2023
profile_positions.title: Researcher PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
I have been awarded initial funding(EURO 5k) for the research and development of mobile air quality monitoring stations to provide early warnings of unhealthy air quality by fusing forecasting weather models with remote sensing. We failed the business model many times but need to be right just once.
The project arising out of this, Respire was awarded 2nd prize in Delft Global Prototype Competition, encouragement prize in Philips Innovation Award 2020 Idea stage, reaching the semi-final stage for the same, top 9 in Ideation Category of TU Delft Impact Challenge ,was chosen as one of the 2 projects (out of 80) to represent TU Delft at the Dutch 4TU Impact Challenge 2020, Finalist of ClimateLaunchpad Netherlands 2021  and Winner (1st Prize) of ReadyToStartup by Yes!Delft and Rolland Berger in Feb 2021.
profile_positions.title: Respire: Founder & Ideator

profile_positions.description: Teaching Assistant for CS4145 Crowd Computing Q4 2020 and IN4398 Advanced Internet of Things Q1 2021.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: Prototyping and implementation of privacy preserving detection of social distancing and human localisation using millimetre Wave radar sensors (60GHz) and wifi trace analysis in collaboration with AMS institute. This project is in response to COVID-19 with Prof. Marco Zuniga and continuation of our effort on a custom made android app based on WiFi and Bluetooth for contact tracing which utilised techniques from indoor localisation.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Mentoring the group of 25 incoming students pursuing masters in Embedded Systems. Sharing my experiences from the past year in order for them to derive the insights which ensures them a successful journey at TU Delft.
profile_positions.title: EEMCS Student Mentor

profile_positions.description: In the summer of 2020, I worked at Web Information Systems Research Group at TU Delft with Prof. Alessandro Bozzon and Prof. Ujwal Gadiraju. Our project focused on the development of a social conversational agent to simulate behaviour change among students in response to the coronavirus crisis while also serving as a platform to gather insightful data for crowd-computing scenarios.
profile_positions.title: Research Engineer

profile_positions.description: I was the coach for the Introduction Programme Summer 2020 for new masters students at TU Delft, which lasts for 4 days fully packed with activities. As a coach, I was responsible for showcasing the academic and social aspects at TU Delft and Delft in general to a group of 10 students hailing from across Europe.
profile_positions.title: Coach IP Summer 2020

profile_positions.description: At Respire, we map the pollution in the air around you, analyse it and provide insights to improve your communities, municipalities and cities. With a small team, we are working on both technological development and building a scalable business plan.
profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
Global network of the ambitious young founders selected for their impact-driven initiatives and their ability to transform broken industries.
Earlier, known as Kairos society which started in 2008 in US.
profile_positions.title: Global Fellow

profile_positions.description:
Talent Investor: Entrepreneur First is the place in the world to meet your co-founder and build a startup from scratch. 
Access to leading advisors, pre-seed funding, and a network of top investors. The companies built at EF are worth over $10bn and backed by some of the world's best tech founders and company builders, like founders of Stripe, Github, Twitch, this platform called Linkedin haha etc.

We learn, we fail, we break up and we start learning again. It's a growth mindset that aims to develop impactful ideas into companies (create new markets 10x) with customer validation while learning to fail and get up again.
profile_positions.title: Founder in Residence

profile_positions.description:
Master thesis at the MIT Senseable City Lab.
After graduation, working remotely on publishing research output.
profile_positions.title: Visiting Researcher

profile_positions.description:
- Airtel is the second largest mobile network in the world.
- Selected as one of 14 engineering graduates from all over India for the Young Technical Leader Programme at Airtel. This programme allowed me to experience the 3 different engineering departments at Airtel within 1 year and later understand & foster deep collaboration between different departments.
- Initiated and spearheaded the development of Google Assistant based Digital customer care from ground up (Industry first of its kind) with multi-lingual support which runs on phones, smart speakers, connected cars, smart displays and other IoT devices. This was showcased at Google For India 2018 and launched pan-india in October 2018. Our ultimate vision was to allow an uneducated farmer interact with Airtel services digitally using his voice in his native language.
- Research, development, testing and deployment of emerging technologies in myAirtel Android App (App indexing, MVVM architecture, Kotlin).
- Built portal for mass processing of digitally filled PDF files and improved processing time from 2 hours to 16 minutes for same-size input using a newer system architectural design.
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer - Young Tech Leader

profile_positions.description:
Baatna is a platform that enables you to borrow things from people around you by posting your need for any consumer good on the application. We broadcast these needs to people in your neighborhood who can interact with you on the app. A startup where I would like to work again, if given a chance.

- Android Developer: Developed and tested several features, improved UI considerably and other performance enhancements.
--Improved loading time (first load) of app by 30% by moving relevant tasks to background threads.
--Developed user rating system substantially improving the quality of platform
 
- Check out the app at https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.application.baatna&hl=en
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description: Training on Embedded Systems: Learnt about micro-controllers and worked on 8 bit PIC micro-controller and successfully accomplished projects like 433MHz RF synthesiser based on PIC16F877, multiplexing LED patterns in assembly language.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: Organising in-person intercultural events such as mid-summer mystery hunt and easter monday lunch comprising of dutch hosts and international guests!

Organizing both social and educational activities specifically directed at master students of three different Masters degrees at EEMCS TU Delft which includes Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Computer Engineering and Embedded Systems.
Mentoring participating teams on technology development and problem-solution fit.

volunteer_experiences.role: Cultural Connoisseur - Culture and Integration Committee

volunteer_experiences.description: Heralding talks and guiding visitors to digital platforms.
